column1: #Text=Department of Defense report lambasts communication failure in US War on Terror
#Text=WASHINGTON , D.C. — A U.S. Department of Defense advisory committee has released a report harshly criticizing the U.S.-led " [ [ War on Terror ] ] " .
#Text=The report details communication failures with the Muslim world , and notes that current efforts may have achieved the opposite of their intended effect .

#Text=The report released without publicity the Wednesday before Thanksgiving by Defense Science Board , focuses on a failure of communication , which the Defense Science Board considers vital to the war on terror .

#Text=It asserts this failure of " strategic communication " contributes to a perceived " negative image in world opinion and diminished ability to persuade " of the United States , and that a resulting atmosphere of hostility can manifest in numerous ways .

#Text=The report further claims ,  American direct intervention in the Muslim World has paradoxically elevated the stature of and support for radical Islamists . "

column1: #Text=As summarised in a Christian Science Monitor headline , ' They hate our policies , not our freedom ' .
#Text=So why has support for the U.S. dropped ? -- to single digits in some Arab nations .
#Text=President Bush and others have famously claimed that America is hated for its freedom .
#Text=But the Defense Science Board concluded that most Arabs " do not hate us for our values , but because of our policies . "
#Text=This study explains that while support for American values may not be overwhelming , it is practically non-existent for America 's policies in the Middle East .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The overwhelming majority voice their objections to what they see as one-sided support in favor of Israel and against Palestinian rights , and the longstanding , even increasing support for what Muslims collectively see as tyrannies , most notably Egypt , Saudi Arabia , Jordan , Pakistan , and the Gulf states .
